channel.title: Should I learn java?
channel.description:
LOL I am sooo interested in java, except that im to lazy to keep on learning it I assume to myself. I wanna learn java so I can make my own server tools for people who don't really know how to get much control over there server :). But is java worth learning? Give me reasons why.
Just so anyone know...im not interested in server development... Its shitty and not worth my time. - No Offence
EDIT: By the way, does anyone have a java cheat sheet? lol would need it :P

item.title: Should I learn java?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Ixl Adds Ixl, post:9, topic:185748”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=248099.msg2084112#msg2084112 date=1204495150]
When you fully understand the concept of object-oriented programming you may start programming Java. Apply what you have learned from OOP in Java, and you shall succeed.
[/quote]

Ok, from my understanding OOP is pretty much about how things are built. Kind of like a blue print sheet in a way. OOP is like building your own machine on how it should operate.[/quote]

And Java is how you build it. You can learn Java, to say, become a general builder or you can learn a more specific, custom made programming language to become say, an Electrician, a Plumber etc. All of these are incorporated into programming, it’s just a matter of preference.

Read full topic

item.title: Should I learn java?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

All of them.

en.wikipedia.org

Object-oriented programming

Object-oriented programming (OOP) is a programming paradigm based on the concept of "objects", which may contain data, in the form of fields, often known as attributes; and code, in the form of procedures, often known as methods. A feature of objects is that an object's procedures can access and often modify the data fields of the object with which they are associated (objects have a notion of "this" or "self"). In OOP, computer programs are designed by making them out of objects that interact w...

Read full topic
